pair.value: circle border part
This object represents a circle border part with the middle point (x, y), radius r, given border line width and from start angle s clockwise till end angle e .
position of the center point in dimension 1 (x)
position of the center point in dimension 2 (y)
size of the radius r
width of the border line (the border goes from radius r to (r - w); standard value is 1)
angle s in radian betwean (clockwise, in positiy dimension 2 direction) the 1 dimension achsis (x) for the circle center and circle part begin
angle e in radian betwean (clockwise, in positiy dimension 2 direction) the 1 dimension achsis (x) for the circle center and circle part end
The points of the circle. The subobject is called for every point on the circle border.
the position of the circle point in dimension 1 (x)
the position of the circle point in dimension 2 (y)
Betti Oesterholz
This object represents a upper or lower left circle line part.
position of the center point of the circle in dimension 1 (x)
position of the center point of the circle in dimension 2 (y)
size of the radius r; if positiv the upper half will be drawn else the lower half will be drawn
width of the border line (the border goes from radius r to (r - w); standard value is 1)
The points of the circle. The subobject is called for every point on the circle border.
the position of the circle point in dimension 1 (x)
the position of the circle point in dimension 2 (y)

position of the center point of the circle in dimension 2 (y)
size of the radius r; if positiv the upper half will be drawn else the lower half will be drawn
width of the border line (the border goes from radius r to (r - w); standard value is 1)
the angle alpha (from the x axis) of the first border (not 0 and betwean -PI/2 and PI/2)
the angle betha (from the x axis) of the second border (not 0 and betwean -PI/2 and PI/2; it have to be more rigth ( greater first dimension values ) than the first border)
